it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket

Class PaddedIpSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Socket
      • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Ip4Socket
        • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.PaddedIpSocket

  • public class PaddedIpSocket
extends Ip4Socket
    PaddedIpSocket implements an IP socket for sending and receiving IP packets with data size greater or equal to a given value.

    If the length of a IP packet is less than a given minimum transfer unit, the packet is zero-padded before sending. The packet length field of the IP header changes when padding is added.

    For developers: in order to let the packet length field unchanged, the raw mode should be used instead. In this case the IP header should be explicitly generated.
